docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Dec. 19. -- Jubilation and thanksgiving pervaded the Pan-American Conference today over the eleven-day armistice halting seventeen months of conflict between the armies of Bolivia and Paraguay in the Gran Chaco. It is felt there is little...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Dec. 19. -- Jubilation and thanksgiving pervaded the Pan-American Conference today over the eleven-day armistice halting seventeen months of conflict between the armies of Bolivia and Paraguay in the Gran Chaco. It is felt there is little likelihood of renewal of the struggle that already has cost 100,000 lives.

headline.main: NEW ERA OF PEACE IN AMERICAS SEEN; Montevideo Delegates Voice Belief Chaco War Will Be the Last in This Hemisphere. PRAISE FOR PEACEMAKERS League Commission, Conference Group, President Terra and Secretary Hull Credited.

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITE.Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Dec. 19. -- The armistice between Bolivia and Paraguay, which goes into effect tonight until Dec. 30 is largely a result of Secretary of State Hull's peace initiative and the patient, persistent manner in which he has worked behind the...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Dec. 19. -- The armistice between Bolivia and Paraguay, which goes into effect tonight until Dec. 30 is largely a result of Secretary of State Hull's peace initiative and the patient, persistent manner in which he has worked behind the scenes with the fixed determination that the Pan-American Conference should not adjourn without terminating the Chaco war.

headline.main: END OF CHACO WAR CREDITED TO HULL; Latin - American Colleagues Say He Worked Behind Scenes for Peace. PRESSURE ON LA PAZ CITED Our Secretary of State Is Said to Have Gone to Uruguay With Complete Program Ready.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 20 -- The seventh Pan-American Conference narrowly escaped going on the rocks with a bang this afternoon on Paraguay's announcement of the capture of Fort Munoz and three other forts yesterday. Casto Rojas and Arturo...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 20 -- The seventh Pan-American Conference narrowly escaped going on the rocks with a bang this afternoon on Paraguay's announcement of the capture of Fort Munoz and three other forts yesterday. Casto Rojas and Arturo Escalier of Bolivia were indignant, contending it was a tacit even if not a legal violation of the armistice that has been arranged.
docs.abstract: Paraguay takes 4 forts; Bolivia charges bad faith, and nearly breaks up Pan Amer Conf

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 21. -- The forthcoming negotiations to end the Chaco war were under a cloud tonight as Bolivia accused Paraguay of a breach of the truce which began at midnight on Tuesday, Dec. 19.

docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 21. -- The nations of the world should adjust internal commodity price levels as the first step toward prosperity, Spruille Braden of the United States delegation to the Seventh Pan-American Conference told the commission on economic and financial matters this morning.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIEDO, Dec. 22 -- Three days' dangerous crisis, threatening to break up the Chaco peace negotiations, was successfully overcome late this afternoon when Bolivia and Paraguay agreed to leave to a League of Nations subcommittee determination of...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIEDO, Dec. 22 -- Three days' dangerous crisis, threatening to break up the Chaco peace negotiations, was successfully overcome late this afternoon when Bolivia and Paraguay agreed to leave to a League of Nations subcommittee determination of whether their armistice was violated by Paraguay in occupying four forts.
docs.abstract: Bolivia and Paraguay agree to submit truce violation to League group

headline.main: CHACO MEDIATORS AVERT PEACE RIFT; Bolivia and Paraguay Agree to Submit Truce Violation Charge to League Group. PARLEY MAY BE EXTENDED Holdover Until Next Thursday Is Proposed to Help in Nego- tiation of Final Settlement.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Dec. 23. -- The Pan-American Conference marked time today on the Chaco situation, awaiting the inauguration of peace negotiations early next week by the League of Nations Chaco Commission.
